Articles.Content:
So I just downloaded 1.0 today and everything is great except the fairings. The texture is broken for me, it keeps on trying to re-draw itself or whatever it's called.

Words can't explain, here you go:

If anyone's got any suggestions please post them!

Edited April 28, 2015 by Claw
pic links
I am also experiencing this issue.

That looks like a similar issue when people used to have KVV installed. Kerbal Vessel Viewer messed with other parts and made them all goofy.

I run the linux 64bit client on a laptop with integrated intel graphics and I don't have this issue here. Although I still had to get in and edit KSP.x86_64 to get the aerodynamic effects to show up, been having to do that since 0.17

Except I don't run any graphics mods or any other mods for that matter.

Also a similar thing happens to the heatshield fairings in the VAB but it looks fine outside the VAB
Looks like the same issue as here, can you provide more info on your system please, this is anew bug that we don't know any fix for yet, aside from possibly reinstalling Ubuntu.

Hey sal, thanks for the info but I think I know what the problem is, my video card already has a shader but it could be that it's incompatible with certain things. But on the other hand, if KSP uses it's own shader than it might be that the two are simply not compatible with each-other. Could this be the problem? Because if it is, I can try getting my hands on some other video cards and swapping them out to see if it works.

I'll post the system info later.

These are my specs;

Memory: 8 GB

CPU: IntelÃ‚Â® CoreÃ¢â€žÂ¢2 CPU 6600 @ 2.40GHz Ãƒâ€” 2

Graphics: Gallium 0.4 on AMD CAICOS

OS: 64 bit, Linux 3.13.0-49-generic #83-Ubuntu SMP

If you need more details let me know and I'll provide them
KSP uses the Unity3D shaders which work best with the proprietary driver, Gallium lags behind on shader support.

Hello,

This may be due to multiple parts hidden underneath ! Check it out !! I have not messed with the fairins yet...

Cmdr Zeta

KSP uses the Unity3D shaders which work best with the proprietary driver, Gallium lags behind on shader support.

Right, so is there any fix for it apart from replacing Gallium with something else?
I don't know yet, the only guy who fixed this did it by doing a complete re-install of Ubuntu, but there has to be a better way.
I can try replacing the video card, hopefully it'll do the trick.

I experience graphical glitches when looking at fairings. Basically they seem to have some stripes which fade in and out, depending on the angle from which you watch them. I have a video showing the effect over here, on Dropbox. The heatshield cover thing is also affected by this in the VAB, but outside it seems to work fine.

I'm using the open-source ATi video drivers on Arch Linux x86_64. I'm using the linux-ck kernel for improved CPU performance.

lspci output of my video card:

supervoltage@svlinpc ~> sudo lspci -s 05:00.0 -v
05:00.0 VGA compatible controller: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. [AMD/ATI] Redwood XT [Radeon HD 5670/5690/5730] (prog-if 00 [VGA controller])

	Flags: bus master, fast devsel, latency 0, IRQ 27
	Memory at d0000000 (64-bit, prefetchable) [size=256M]
	Memory at fbfc0000 (64-bit, non-prefetchable) [size=128K]

	Capabilities: [100] Vendor Specific Information: ID=0001 Rev=1 Len=010 <?>
	Capabilities: [150] Advanced Error Reporting
	Kernel driver in use: radeon
	Kernel modules: radeon

It's a known issue with no known resolution yet supervoltage, though it appears driver related, have you tried the proprietary driver?

I haven't tried the proprietary driver, but I'm going to install it and reply to this thread as soon as I do so.

- - - Updated - - -

Back with proprietary video drivers. The ugly effect is now gone. This is with catalyst version 15.200 and the same Linux kernel. However, there must be a way to make it work with the open source drivers as well. Until then, this is one solution to the problem.

Until then, if you run Arch Linux, you can get catalyst-test from here or download the .run file from AMD's website. Just go to their support page, put in your video card model and download the .run file you need. You have to chmod it to be executable then just run it from the terminal.

I don't think installing Arch Linux will do anything but I'm going to try swap out the video card, I think the new card has a Proprietary Driver. I'll reply to this thread again on whether it does anything or not
Tried swapping out the video card and it did not do anything, I'll try to install the Proprietary Driver later

I'm a little confused, did you do anything other than re-install KSP? Did you re-install through Steam or via some other method? I'm having the same fairing texture issue and I'm curious how to fix it, thanks.
I suspect Steam may be installing duplicate files, if you delete the GameData folder then verify the cache in Steam, it'll redownload it and should fix the issue.
